news.title: AIPL to invest ₹987.25 crore to develop residential project along Dwarka Expressway
news.para: AIPL is gearing up to unveil Riviera, a remarkable new residential venture with an investment exceeding ₹987 crore. Situated in the heart of Gurugram's AIPL LakeCity, the project will comprise two soaring 43-floor towers, providing luxurious 3 and 4 BHK living spaces.

news.title: Satya Group, Maple Group to invest ₹1,600 crore in residential project along Dwarka Expressway
news.para: Satya Group and Maple Group are investing ₹1,600 crore in Gurugram's Dwarka Expressway.  Levante Residences will feature three 47-floor towers with 488 units.  Apartments will be available in 3BHK, 4BHK, and 5BHK configurations.   Sales realization is projected at ₹2,000 crore.

news.title: NGT further prohibits sand mining in Goa rivers till next month
news.para: The National Green Tribunal has extended the ban on sand mining in Goa's rivers until January 28, 2026. This decision follows a challenge by the Goa River Sand Protection Network against environmental clearances. The tribunal will not allow any mining activity until the next hearing.

news.title: Vadodara civic body razes 350 dwellings near Dashama pond in Gorwa
news.para: Vadodara Municipal Corporation, at the Gujarat Housing Board's request, razed 350 shanties near Dashama pond in Gorwa. The demolition, spanning two days, targeted dwellings occupied by labourers. GHB plans a housing scheme on the cleared land, having sought VMC's help due to their limited resources for encroachment removal. Residents were previously asked to vacate.

news.title: Map Aravalis and submit clear forest definition, high court tells Haryana
news.para: The Punjab and Haryana High Court has ordered the Haryana government to define the Aravali forest landscape legally. The state must submit a map of the exact Aravali area by January 9, 2026. This directive follows Supreme Court rulings and addresses ongoing pressure from development.

news.title: Lucknow development body to resume registration for plots on Mohan Road
news.para: Lucknow Development Authority is set to reopen registrations for approximately 1,487 developed plots under its Anantnagar residential scheme on Mohan Road. These plots, designated for middle and upper-income groups across various colonies, will be available for registration soon. The process for securing these plots, ranging in size from 112.5 to 450 sq m, will be conducted online.

news.title: Free land regularisation to benefit 70,000 Marathwada families
news.para: Nearly 70,000 families in Marathwada and Chandrapur district received relief. The Hyderabad Inam and Cash Grants Abolition (Amendment) Bill, 2025, was passed. Residential houses on Madat Mash inam lands are now regularised free of cost. Occupants receive full Occupant Class-1 ownership rights. This resolves a long-pending issue for many families.

news.title: PFRDA eases investment norms for REITs, InvITs
news.para: The Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority has announced a revision to investment regulations for National Pension System funds. Investors can now diversify more into Real Estate Investment Trusts and Infrastructure Investment Trusts, an opportunity poised to invigorate local market involvement in cash-generating properties.

news.title: Gurugram: Illegal colonies razed near KMP Expressway in DTCP crackdown
news.para: The Department of Town and Country Planning (DTCP) in Gurugram conducted a demolition drive targeting major unauthorized colonies near the KMP Expressway. Officials razed two illegal colonies spanning 6 acres and 2.3 acres, including structures and internal roads, to curb unplanned settlements. This action aims to deter illegal plotting and construction in the rapidly developing KMP zone.

news.title: Chalet Hotels acquires resort property in Udaipur for ₹171 crore
news.para: Chalet Hotels is set to acquire a 150-room resort in Udaipur for ₹171 crore, pending due diligence. The company also announced leadership changes, appointing Shwetank Singh as MD & CEO and Dr. Sanjay Sethi as a Non-Independent Non-Executive Director, both effective February 1, 2026.

news.title: DPR of Jaipur metro phase-II gets approval from Public Investment Board
news.para: The detailed project report for Jaipur Metro Rail Project Phase-2 has received approval from the Public Investment Board. This marks a significant step forward in the project's development. The next stages involve preparing a cabinet note for further approvals. Officials are working to expedite the process.

news.title: Given ‘slum to rehab’ assurance, Dharavi locals face eviction
news.para: Dharavi residents, promised direct relocation to new flats, are now facing eviction notices. Forty-two families in Ganesh Nagar, Meghwadi, received orders to vacate within seven days for a crucial sewerage pipeline project.  Residents express distress over shifting rent promises and demand alternative housing, not just monetary compensation.

news.title: Hyderabad: Builder pulled up for illegal parking layout changes
news.para: A consumer commission has ordered a builder in Bowrampet to provide a legally approved car parking space. The builder illegally changed the sanctioned stilt-floor layout of Pinewood Apartments. This led to disputes among residents. The commission found evidence of deviations and held the builder liable. The builder must now allot the correct parking slot and pay compensation.

news.title: Sebi amends norms to broaden strategic investor definition for REITs, InvITs
news.para: In a significant development for the investment community, Sebi has revised the criteria for what constitutes a 'strategic investor' in the context of REITs and InvITs. This adjustment aims to open the gates for a more diverse range of investors, including pension and provident funds, to take part in public offerings.

news.title: Bihar government to launch new programme for resolution of land disputes
news.para: Bihar's Revenue and Land Reforms Minister Vijay Kumar Sinha announced 'Bhumi Sudhar Samvad' on December 12 to resolve land disputes and update documents. A special 'Udan Dasta' team will combat land fraud, and a March campaign will target government land encroachment. Strict action is promised against corrupt officials and encroachers.

news.title: MPIDC gets consent for 300 hectare for Indore-Pithampur economic corridor
news.para: Landowners have given consent for nearly 300 hectares for the Indore-Pithampur Economic Corridor. This vital infrastructure project will connect Indore and Pithampur, a major industrial hub. The corridor aims to improve freight movement and reduce travel times. It is expected to attract new industrial investments. Efforts are underway to complete land pooling formalities.

news.title: Kochi: Infopark Phase III gets nodal officer for land pooling
news.para: Shaji V Nair has been appointed nodal officer for the land pooling process of Infopark's Phase III project, covering approximately 500 acres. This move aims to expedite the pooling of 300 acres in Kizhakkambalam panchayat for the integrated IT township.

news.title: HC sets aside Chandigarh housing board decision denying flats to jhuggi dwellers
news.para: The Punjab and Haryana High Court has overturned the Chandigarh Housing Board's rejection of jhuggi dwellers' claims for flats under the 2006 scheme. The court ruled the decision was made without a hearing, violating their right to be considered for housing. The administration must now re-evaluate their claims within two months.

news.title: Ekta World repays ₹170 crore to ICICI Bank
news.para: Ekta World has successfully repaid ₹170 crore to ICICI Bank. This repayment was fully supported by sales and collections from their completed project, Ekta Tripolis.
